boardgame.name: Advanced Squad Leader: Starter Kit #2
ASL Starter Kit #2
boardgame.description: (from MMP website:)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;ASL Starter Kit #2 is a self-contained module which will let players start playing Advanced Squad Leader almost immediately. A liberally-illustrated rulebook teaches gamers ASL using a conversational style to teach the concepts of ASL. If you own and play ASL Starter Kit #1 you will be pleasantly surprised to find how easy it is to spot the new rules ASLSK#2 adds - we've highlighted the new rules so that you can skip rereading what you've learned in ASLSK#1 and get right to the new rules!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;What does ASLSK#2 add? GUNS! Artillery pieces. Anti-tank guns. The famous and deadly German _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;88_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;. Mortars and bazookas! ASLSK#2 adds the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;to hit_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; procedure to the foundation you learned in ASLSK#1. And if you didn't get ASLSK#1? There are two _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;infantry only_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; scenarios to get you up to speed!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This answers the inevitable question we get with the Starter Kit concept. Do I need ASLSK#2 if I have ASLSK#1? The Starter Kits are self contained. Each has everything you need to play what's in the box, with the higher numbers adding to the ASL knowledge you'll have from playing previous Starter Kits. We do not anticipate changing what you've learned from prior Starter Kits (for example, ASLSK#2 adds about 4 pages of rules to the base built by ASLSK#1). A better question would be _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Do I need ASLSK#1 if I buy ASLSK#2?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;. The short answer is a resounding no! You can dive right in with ASLSK#2. But if you do, and you like the game, ASLSK#1 adds more boards and scenarios (infantry only) for you to enjoy. We know it's a little confusing, we hope this clears it up a bit._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Contents:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 2 8x22 Geomorphic Maps (w and x) for the ASL System_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 1 full Countersheet of 1/2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; counters_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 1 half Countersheet of 5/8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; counters_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 8 scenarios printed on 4 individual cardstock sheets_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 2 quick reference charts printed on cardstock sheet_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 1 20-page rules booklet (about 17 pages are rules) with plentiful color illustrations_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 2 dice_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Scenario List:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; S9 Ambitious Assault Avola, Sicily, 10 July 1943_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; S10 Paper Army Sarandoporo River Valley, Greece, 3 Nov 1940_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; S11 A Long Way to Go Biscari Station, Sicily, 10 July 1943_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; S12 Over Open Sights Skyline Drive, Luxembourg, 17 December 1944_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; S13 Priority Target Korinthos, Greece, 26 April 1941_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; S14 88s at Zon Zon, Holland, 17 September 1944_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; S15 Hammer to the Teeth Bleialf, Germany, 16 December 1944_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; S16 Legio Patria Nostra Radicofani, Italy, 18 June 1944_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Time Scale: 2 minutes per Game Turn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Unit Scale: 5 to 10 men, plus individual leaders, vehicles, guns_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Map Scale: 40 meters per hex_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players: 2 (also suitable for solitaire or team play)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Complexity: Medium_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Solitaire Suitability: Medium_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;(user's description:)The second in the three-part series of starter kits for ASL. The goal of the ASL Starter Kits is to introduce the rules of the massive World War Two wargame in more manageable pieces. While the first starter kit focused on small infantry-only skirmishes, the second is based around confrontations involving infantry and the use of battlefield ordnance. The Germans and Americans return, this time accompanied by the British and Italians._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The box is a complete game, including rules (complete with updated rules from Advanced Squad Leader: Starter Kit #1), 1 full and 1 half counter sheet, two new geomorphic boards (w and x) and 8 new scenarios, (S9 through S16)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The Starter Kit series is continued (and completed) with ASL Starter Kit #3, which introduces Armored Fighting Vehicles._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2005 Charles S. Roberts Best World War II Boardgame Nominee
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Advanced Squad Leader Starter Kit Scenario Design Contest
Rally Point Volume 2: Advanced Squad Leader Starter Kit Special Study

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

never played +++++ english version +++++ will be shipped with insurance +++++ payment for germany : personal pick up in berlin or bank transfer +++++ payment for usa, canada, asia and australia : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have no euro : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have euro : direct bank transfer (wich is cost-free !) or cash (by letter) +++++ for all : no checks ! +++++ foreign buyers beware : german postal sadly is very expensive for foreign packages (about 18 - 45 euros, it depends on, where the package has to be shipped or what´s it´s weight), pleask at for prices, befor you buy !) +++++ shipping inside germany will cost 8 euros

Multi-Man Publishing (MUM ASLSTARTER2) ASL Starter Kit #2 is a self-contained module which will let players start playing Advanced Squad Leader almost immediately. A liberally-illustrated rulebook teaches gamers ASL using a conversational style to teach the concepts of ASL. If you own and play ASL Starter Kit #1 you will be plesantly surprised to find how easy it is to spot the new rules ASLSK#2 adds - we_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve highlighted the new rules so that you can skip rereading what you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve learned in ASLSK#1 and get right to the new rules! What does ASLSK#2 add? GUNS! Artillery pieces. Anti-tank guns. The famous and deadly German _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;88_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. Mortars and bazookas! ASLSK#2 adds the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;to hit_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; procedure to the foundation you learned in ASLSK#1. And if you didn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t get ASLSK#1? There are two _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;infantry only_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; scenarios to get you up to speed! This answers the inevitable question we get with the Starter Kit concept. Do I need ASLSK#2 if I have ASLSK#1? The Starter Kits are self contained. Each has everything you need to play what_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s in the box, with the higher numbers adding to the ASL knowledge you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll have from playing previous Starter Kits. We do not anticipate changing what you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve learned from prior Starter Kits (for example, ASLSK#2 adds about 4 pages of rules to the base built by ASLSK#1). A better question would be _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Do I need ASLSK#1 if I buy ASLSK#2?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. The short answer is a resounding no! You can dive right in with ASLSK#2. But if you do, and you like the game, ASLSK#1 adds more boards and scenarios (infantry only) for you to enjoy. We know it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a little confusing, we hope this clears it up a bit. 2 8x22 Geomorphic Maps (w and x) for the ASL System 1 full Countersheet of 1/2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; counters 1 half Countersheet of 5/8_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; counters 8 scenarios printed on 4 individual cardstock sheets 2 quick reference charts printed on cardstock sheet 1 20-page rules booklet (about 17 pages are rules) with plentiful color illustrations 2 dice Time Scale: 2 minutes per Game Turn Unit Scale: 5 to 10 men, plus individual leaders, vehicles, guns Map Scale 40 meters per hex Players: 2 (also suitable for solitaire or team play) Complexity: Medium Solitaire Suitability: Medium
Scenario List: S9 Ambitious Assault Avola, Sicily, 10 July 1943. British/American vs. Italian S10 Paper Army Sarandoporo River Valley, Greece, 3 Nov 1940. Greek vs. Italian S11 A Long Way to Go Biscari Station, Sicily, 10 July 1943. American vs. German S12 Over Open Sights Skyline Drive, Luxembourg, 17 December 1944. American vs. German S13 Priority Target Korinthos, Greece, 26 April 1941. British/Greek vs. German S14 88s at Zon Zon, Holland, 17 September 1944. American vs. German S15 Hammer to the Teeth Bleialf, Germany, 16 December 1944. American vs. German S16 Legio Patria Nostra Radicofani, Italy, 18 June 1944. Free French vs. German

Punched, in old Avalon Hill-style counter tray. Some shelf wear on box with a very small amount of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;crush_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; on the lid, causing some wrinkles on the box lid corners. Nothing serious, I assure you. Contents are in excellent shape throughout. GET ALL THREE STARTER KITS FOR $110. BLOODY DO IT NOW! READ THIS, please. 1) Will ship anywhere at cost. Insurance/tracking, if available, at buyer_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s discretion and expense. 2) I will ALWAYS combine shipping. 3) I am ALWAYS open to offers if you’re considering a multi-game purchase. Do me the courtesy to extend a genuine offer and I will consider it seriously and provide a courteous response. 4) I can sometimes ship from the USA and save US buyers some $$ on shipping - just Geekmail me and ask when I will next be in MN. For large purchases I can make a special trip to the border but, please, do not ask me to drive there and deal with the Customs thugs (both ways, mind you!) to save $6 on a $20 purchase.

Shipping will be actual cost of your preferred method plus costs of delivery confirmation and insurance if you want it. I will ship overseas, but be aware that U.S postal prices have gone up very high to mail outside the U.S.

Learn how to play with Guns and other destructive stuff! The contents of the game are well cared for, counters partially punched, with the corners lightly clipped: check the images. It is a very good copy. Buyer pays shipping. Paypal is OK, but I prefer bank transfer if you are in Europe. I could keep this one under 1 kg with packaging and protective stuff, but if I ask for more money than it costs at the end, I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll refund the difference via Paypal as a gift. Orientative shipping, so you have an idea: España (Ordinary 4.58€ / Certified 7€); Europe (Ord. 12.46€ / Cert. 15.27€); USA, Canada and Australasia (around 20€ with tracking, but I have to check first) ****** El juego está en muy buen estado, tal como se aprecia en las imágenes, las fichas parcialmente destroqueladas, con las esquinas ligeramente recortadas. Se trata de un ejemplar en muy buen estado. Aunque acepto Paypal, prefiero transferencia bancaria, sobre todo si el comprador reside en la península y en Europa. El envío, cuyo gasto corre a cargo del comprador, podría hacerse por Correos (4,58€ Ordinario / 7 € Certificado), o por Kiala (www.kiala.es) que tiene una tarifa de 5 euros hasta 8 kilos.

Thank you so much for your continued support of Wargame Depot which has allowed us to give generously to the VSF. Mint, in shrink copy available. No dings, no dents, or anything wrong with the game. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m the owner of Wargame Depot so a purchase from me will always be packed professionally and I can accept Paypal, MO/Check, or MC/Visa/Discover/AMEX. North Carolina residents pay 7% sales tax. Cheers, Jason PS: We have many Osprey books in stock not listed on BGG. The prices are well under publisher rates; if you are interested in them, please let me know!
